chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact or Sexual Intercourse w/ Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheldon L James

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sheldon L James appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Sheldon L James.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective P. Miner. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 06.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sheldon L James in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Sheldon L James.  Attorney Jessica Bellows for Emily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Matter in court for Doctor's Report Return.

Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.

Court orders case adjourned for a Preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sheldon L James in court, via zoom, with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Sheldon L James in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 15. CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Doctor's Report Return.   Competency Hearing proceeded.  State and defense does not challenge Dr. Collins' report.  

Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent.  Court makes not order as to medication. Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility.  

Court ordered case adjourned, Branch 15.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact/No Firearms Order, signed and filed

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Sheldon L James not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sheldon L James not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness checked in prior to the case being called. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with TLC.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Sheldon L James in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Sheldon L James in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
